title: How to sell my used textbooks - Quora

response.answer_text: Selling your used textbooks can be easier than you think! I recommend selling textbooks close to the beginning of a semester. For example, in a couple of weeks, just before the Spring 2020 semester begins for most schools, you’ll want to sell your textbooks. It’s also really important to consider your selling options. BookScouter has a comparison tool to help you see over thirty textbook buyback options at once, including Amazon! We take care of the search, you just sell those college textbooks. If you prefer in-person selling, many college towns have book exchange shops where you can sell used textbooks. Be sure to call around to see who is offering the best rate. Post The Book. Share what you’re selling the book on your student portal or on a student-to-student book exchange facebook page. You’ll save your friends the hassle of buying elsewhere and minimize the chance of shipping costs. For more tips on how to sell your used textbooks, check out this article: BookScouter

Go to Ebay. On the top, you'll find a small link with the word "Sell". Click on that, select the appropriate options, fill in the details, and you're live! If someone wants to buy them, they'll contact you there, and pay for it. You'll then have to ship the books to their address using a courier service. Done.

There’s really not much resale value for used textbooks. I haven’t been in one in many years, but college bookstores used to buy them back. Probably not any more. Craig’s List? Departmental bulletin boards? Set up a table during registration? Or is that all online now? Good luck.

At the beginning of each school year is the best time to put up some signs on the bulletin boards of the schools… You can also supplement those bulletin postings with a matching on social networks like LinkIn, etc., or neighborhood stores and webpages.. The proper timing when to put up your posting is the essence..
